result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J Freiermuth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: --to maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent

--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent

--to provide DNA sample 

Arresting Agency: JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

timeConds.notes:
--to serve 30 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on  8/26/16; the Court authorizes Mr. Freiermuth to beginning the conditional jail early if so inclined. 

--the Court authorizes transfer of the jail terms to Dane County so long as it is without electronic monitoring.

Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua J Freiermuth

records.addlTxt: DOC Balance Inquiry
Granted
Hold 5 days
from DOC Agent along with Probation Early Discharge Recommendation
Associated with Charge #1
Jefferson County DNA Proof of Submission
Letters in Support of Defendant
Criminal Case Settlement
Huber Law / Work Release Notification

Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley for Branch IV

Case called at 3:33pm
Defendant Joshua J Freiermuth in court with attorney Eric Theodore Raskopf.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Teuber submits an Amended Information
--Atty. Raskopf admits service, waives reading

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered to the charge in the Amended Information; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel 
Statement made Robert Freiermuth
Statement made by Joshua Freiermuth

The Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:

--to serve 30 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on  8/26/16; the Court authorizes Mr. Freiermuth to beginning the conditional jail early if so inclined. 
--the Court authorizes transfer of the jail terms to Dane County so long as it is without electronic monitoring.

--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to pay statutory costs
--to provide DNA sample 


Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess:4:15pm
